Package backend

Class InputValidator

java.lang.Object
backend.InputValidator
public class InputValidator
extends java.lang.Object
This class holds static methods for validating Record objects and their fields.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    InputValidator()

    Modifier and Type Method Description

    static java.lang.String getFbicd​(java.lang.String primaryDescription, java.lang.String secondaryDescription)

    Checks whether the string is a true, false, or null value for a field as specified in the Record class.
    static boolean hasValidCaseNumber​(java.lang.String caseNumber)
    Checks if case number has a valid length (eight), the first two starting characters are letters and the rest of the characters are digits (no special characters are allowed).

    Checks the given List of Strings has valid crime descriptions

  • Method Details

    • initializeCrimeDescriptions

      public static java.util.Set<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> initializeCrimeDescriptions() throws com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException, java.io.IOException
      Initializes set of valid crime descriptions (Primary, Secondary and IUCR information from a given CSV file
      Returns:
      Set of String descriptions of a crime (IUCR, Primary Description, Secondary Description and FBICD)
      Throws:
      com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
      java.io.IOException

    • hasValidCrimeDescriptions

      public static boolean hasValidCrimeDescriptions​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> candidateCrimeDescriptions) throws com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException, java.io.IOException
      Checks the given List of Strings has valid crime descriptions
      Parameters:
      candidateCrimeDescriptions - usually String array of crime descriptions ((IUCR, Primary Description, Secondary Description and FBICD)
      Returns:
      boolean value if the crime descriptions are valid
      Throws:
      com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
      java.io.IOException

    • hasGpsCoordinate

      public static boolean hasGpsCoordinate​(java.lang.String gpsCoordinate, float lowerRange, float upperRange)
      Checks if the given coordinate lies within or is equal to the lower and upper range parameters provided.
      Parameters:
      gpsCoordinate - the coordinate, which is one number as a String, e.g. "-47.123456"
      lowerRange - a float specifying the lower bound (inclusive)
      upperRange - a float specifying the upper bound (inclusive)
      Returns:
      true or false depending on the validity of the coordinate

    • hasValidInt

      public static boolean hasValidInt​(java.lang.String data, boolean emptyAllowed)
      Checks whether the string provided is a valid integer value.
      Parameters:
      data - the String to be checked
      emptyAllowed - whether the number can be empty
      Returns:
      true or false

    • hasValidDouble

      public static boolean hasValidDouble​(java.lang.String data)
      Checks whether the string provided is a valid double value.
      Parameters:
      data - the String to be checked
      Returns:
      true or false

    • hasValidBooleanData

      public static boolean hasValidBooleanData​(java.lang.String domestic)
      Checks whether the string is a true, false, or null value for a field as specified in the Record class.
      Parameters:
      domestic - a String representing a potential boolean value
      Returns:
      boolean true/false whether the string is valid or not

    • recordEntryFeedbackLong

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> recordEntryFeedbackLong​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> record, boolean notImport) throws com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException, java.io.IOException
      Identifies whether each field in a record is valid, whether the record overall is valid, and provides an error message if applicable.
      Parameters:
      record - a list of strings representing a Record object. This can be generated with the toList() method of the Record class.
      Returns:
      a list consisting of 16 values (1 = valid, 0 = invalid) corresponding to each field of a Record object in the order produced by toList(), with an additional 1/0 field for overall validity, and an error message ONLY IF there was an error - field is not included (i.e. not a blank field) if data is valid. The message corresponds to the first invalid field.
      Throws:
      com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
      java.io.IOException

    • isValidRecord

      public static boolean isValidRecord​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> record, boolean notImport) throws java.io.IOException, com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
      Identifies whether a given record is valid using recordEntryFeedbackLong. Provides no feedback other than true/false.
      Parameters:
      record - a list of strings representing a Record object. This can be generated with the toList() method of the Record class.
      Returns:
      boolean value depending on the validity of the record
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException

      public static void printCrimeDescriptions() throws com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException, java.io.IOException
      Prints valid list of crime descriptions
      Throws:
      com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
      java.io.IOException

    • hasValidCaseNumber

      public static boolean hasValidCaseNumber​(java.lang.String caseNumber)
      Checks if case number has a valid length (eight), the first two starting characters are letters and the rest of the characters are digits (no special characters are allowed).
      Parameters:
      caseNumber - the case number to validate
      Returns:
      boolean value whether the case number is valid

    • hasValidDateAndTimeFormat

      public static boolean hasValidDateAndTimeFormat​(java.lang.String dateAndTime)
      Checks whether the provided string is a valid date/time based on the format defined in the Record class.
      Parameters:
      dateAndTime - a candidate date and time String
      Returns:
      true or false depending on validity of data and time string.

      public static java.util.Set<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getCrimeDescriptions() throws com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException, java.io.IOException
      Initializes Set of list of valid crime descriptions and returns it in the order of (IUCR number, Primary Description, Secondary Description and FBICD)
      Returns:
      Set of list of Crime Description
      Throws:
      com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException

    • getSetOfPrimaryDescriptions

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSetOfPrimaryDescriptions() throws com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException, java.io.IOException
      Initializes crimeDescription, selects and returns set of primary description from the list of the initialized crime descriptions
      Returns:
      Set of Strings (Primary Description)
      Throws:
      com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
      java.io.IOException

    • getSetOfSecondaryDescriptions

      public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSetOfSecondaryDescriptions​(java.lang.String primaryDescription) throws com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException, java.io.IOException
      Filters and returns set of Secondary descriptions that relate to the passed primary description parameter
      Parameters:
      primaryDescription - a crime's primary description string, which usually identifies the type of crime
      Returns:
      Set of Strings secondary descriptions if any or null if empty
      Throws:
      com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
      java.io.IOException

    • getIucr

      public static java.lang.String getIucr​(java.lang.String primaryDescription, java.lang.String secondaryDescription) throws com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException, java.io.IOException
      Given the primary description and secondary description for a crime, it returns the associated IUCR value
      Parameters:
      primaryDescription - a crime's primary description string, which usually identifies the type of crime
      secondaryDescription - a crime's secondary description, usually further specifying the type of crime
      Returns:
      returns String (IUCR) of a crime type, if crime type does not exists it returns null
      Throws:
      com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
      java.io.IOException

    • getFbicd

      public static java.lang.String getFbicd​(java.lang.String primaryDescription, java.lang.String secondaryDescription) throws com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException, java.io.IOException
      Given the primary description and secondary description for a crime, it returns the associated FBICD value
      Parameters:
      primaryDescription - a crime's primary description string, which usually identifies the type of crime
      secondaryDescription - a crime's secondary description, usually further specifying the type of crime
      Returns:
      returns String (FBICD) of a crime type, if crime type does not exists it returns null
      Throws:
      com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
      java.io.IOException
